required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 09, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CT Scores Predict Mortality in 2019-nCoV Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: CT Scores Predict Mortality in 2019-nCoV Pneumonia

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock:
While 2019-nCoV nucleic acid swab tests has high false positives rate, How to diagnose
      2019-nCoV pneumonia and predict prognosis by CT is very important.In this retrospective
      single-center study, we consecutively included suspected 2019-nCoV pneumonia critical cases
      in the intensive care unit of Wuhan third hospital from January 31, 2020 to February 16,
      2020. The cases were confirmed by real-time RT-PCR, and all patients were evaluated with CT,
      cutoff values were obtained according to the Yoden index, and were divided into high CT score
      group and low CT score group. Epidemiological, demographic, clinical, and laboratory data
      were collected.

clinical_study.condition: CT Scores Predict Mortality in 2019-nCoV Pneumonia

intervention.description: CT score = normal lung tissue (%) ×1 + GGO (%) ×2 + consolidation (%) ×3

study_pop.textblock: all patients suspected of 2019 novel coronavirus infection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all patients suspected of 2019 novel coronavirus infection.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients' data are not available.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
